intro: Anemia retroflexa, commonly known as the curled leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, curling leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Anemia retroflexa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
